nerot
Class Nerot

java.lang.Object
  nerot.Nerot

public class Nerot
extends Object

Nerot lets you to easily schedule tasks on the fly (using Quartz and Spring), calling any object instance's method with any arguments you specify (class method or instance method) and can cache the result for access in a separate thread with built-in RSS retrieval and caching (using Rome). Scheduling supports the Quartz cron-like syntax. It uses an in-memory store for quick asynchronous retrieval, but Tasks and Storing are fully customizable and extensible via the API (uses interfaces, etc.).

Constructor Detail

Nerot

public Nerot()
Method Detail

scheduleHttpGet

public void scheduleHttpGet(String url,
                            String cronSchedule)
                     throws ParseException,
                            org.quartz.SchedulerException,
                            ClassNotFoundException,
                            NoSuchMethodException
Creates and schedules an RssTask using feedUrl as the storeKey, feedUrl, and jobId, for convenience. Uses BaseTask defaults so may block thread for a defined amount of time to wait on the first run validation. By defining your own RssTask and using schedule(...), you will have much more control over this.

Parameters:
url - URL of the external resource
cronSchedule - A Quartz cron schedule. essentially like unix CRON except it adds an additional prefix for seconds like "0/5 * * * * ?" for every five seconds.
Throws:
ParseException
org.quartz.SchedulerException
ClassNotFoundException
NoSuchMethodException

getHttpResponseBodyFromStore

public String getHttpResponseBodyFromStore(String url)
Get the response body from an HTTP GET from the Store using the specified url as the key. This is equivalent to calling get(url) but it casts the result as String.

Parameters:
url - URL of the external resource
Returns:
the response body

scheduleRss

public void scheduleRss(String feedUrl,
                        String cronSchedule)
                 throws ParseException,
                        org.quartz.SchedulerException,
                        ClassNotFoundException,
                        NoSuchMethodException
Creates and schedules an RssTask using feedUrl as the storeKey, feedUrl, and jobId, for convenience. Uses BaseTask defaults so may block thread for a defined amount of time to wait on the first run validation. By defining your own RssTask and using schedule(...), you will have much more control over this.

Parameters:
feedUrl - an RSS feed URL
cronSchedule - A Quartz cron schedule. essentially like unix CRON except it adds an additional prefix for seconds like "0/5 * * * * ?" for every five seconds.
Throws:
ParseException
org.quartz.SchedulerException
ClassNotFoundException
NoSuchMethodException

getRssFromStore

public com.sun.syndication.feed.synd.SyndFeed getRssFromStore(String feedUrl)
Get a SyndFeed from the Store using the specified feedUrl as the key. This is equivalent to calling get(feedUrl), casting the result as SyndFeed.

Parameters:
feedUrl - an RSS feed URL that was scheduled
Returns:
the SyndFeed result of Rome RSS parsing the feed URL

schedule

public void schedule(String jobId,
                     Task task,
                     String cronSchedule)
              throws ParseException,
                     org.quartz.SchedulerException,
                     ClassNotFoundException,
                     NoSuchMethodException
Schedule any Task. If you are looking for a generic way to call any object, see the GenericTask wrapper.

Parameters:
jobId - an arbitrary jobId that can be used to ensure that: the same job is not started twice if called twice, the schedule can be changed for that job just by calling schedule again, and the job can be cancelled without having to cancel all.
task - the Task to execute
cronSchedule - A Quartz cron schedule. essentially like unix CRON except it adds an additional prefix for seconds like "0/5 * * * * ?" for every five seconds.
Throws:
ParseException
org.quartz.SchedulerException
ClassNotFoundException
NoSuchMethodException

getResultFromStore

public Object getResultFromStore(String key)
Get an Object from the Store that was set by a Task.

Parameters:
key - the key set on the GenericTask, the feedUrl, or whatever key was used by the Task/called object as the key for the value in the Store.
Returns:
result from Store for the specified key

unschedule

public void unschedule(String jobId)
                throws org.quartz.SchedulerException
This unschedules a task, by calling deleteJob on the Quartz scheduler.

Parameters:
jobId - the job id specified previously in a schedule method.
Throws:
org.quartz.SchedulerException

unscheduleAll

public void unscheduleAll()
                   throws org.quartz.SchedulerException
This unschedules all tasks, using the unschedule method.

Throws:
org.quartz.SchedulerException

getStore

public Store getStore()
Gets the Store used by Nerot's get methods. You shouldn't need to access this directly.

Returns:
the Store

setStore

public void setStore(Store store)
Sets the Store used by Nerot's get methods. You shouldn't need to access this directly. It is set via Spring.

Parameters:
store - the Store

Gets the Quartz Scheduler instance. You shouldn't need to access this directly.

Returns:
the Scheduler

setScheduler

public void setScheduler(org.quartz.Scheduler scheduler)
Sets the Quartz Scheduler instance. You shouldn't need to access this directly. It is set via Spring.

Parameters:
scheduler - the Scheduler
